title: Trump, Iran and the Specter of Iraq: ‘We Bought All the Happy Talk’
summary: President Trump is pondering swift military action in Iran. There were similar expectations that the war in Iraq would be quick and triumphant.

title: U.S. Strike on Iran Would Bring Risks at Every Turn
summary: The largest perils may lie in the aftermath, many experts say, just as they did in Afghanistan and Iraq.

title: Iranian Civilians Are Killed in Israeli Strikes, Including a Poet and an Equestrian
summary: Israel has said it does not target Iranian civilians, but hundreds have died in the violence, among them a poet and her family, an equestrian and a graphic designer.

title: Social Security Benefits Could Be Cut in 8 Years Unless Congress Acts
summary: The nation’s key program for retiree benefits continues to see financing shortfalls. Unless Congress acts, those drops could lead to payment cuts in eight years.

title: Supreme Court Upholds Ban on Transgender Care for Minors
summary: The justices ruled that the state’s law, which prohibited some medical treatments for transgender youths, did not violate equal protection principles.

title: Sotomayor’s Dissent Criticizes Supreme Court Decision in Transgender Care Case
summary: Justice Sotomayor also read her dissent from the bench, a move typically reserved to emphasize a justice’s extreme displeasure with a decision.

title: For Tennessee’s Transgender Families, Supreme Court Ruling Was Bitter, but Expected
summary: The state has been a leader in the rollback of L.G.B.T.Q. rights.

title: Democrats’ Wary Response to Transgender Ruling Shows the Party’s Retreat
summary: While some in the party denounced the Supreme Court’s decision, other top leaders remained quiet, underscoring the party’s discomfort on the issue.

title: Trump Travel Restrictions Bar Residents Needed at U.S. Hospitals
summary: Limits on travel and visa appointments have delayed or prevented foreign doctors from entering the country for jobs set to begin in weeks.

title: U.S. to Review Social Media Posts of Student and Scholar Visa Applicants
summary: The State Department is restarting the processing of visa applications from students and visiting scholars, but is screening for  “hostility” toward the United States.

title: Trump Quizzes Workers at the White House: ‘Any Illegal Immigrants?’
summary: President Trump decided to check the immigration status of a work crew installing a new flagpole at the White House.

title: For Food Network Fans, Anne Burrell Was the Fun-Loving Aunt
summary: The chef, who died Tuesday, built her stardom on a big, down-to-earth personality in which viewers could see themselves.

title: Food Network Chefs Pay Tribute to Anne Burrell
summary: Following news of the chef and TV personality’s death at age 55, remembrances poured in on social media.

title: Karen Read Acquitted in Murder Trial Over Boyfriend’s Death Outside Boston
summary: A jury cleared Ms. Read of charges related to the 2022 death of John O’Keefe, a Boston police officer, and convicted her only of drunken driving, in a trial that attracted wide attention.

title: Karen Read Acquitted of Murder and Manslaughter in Retrial: What We Know
summary: A jury found Ms. Read not guilty of murder and manslaughter on Wednesday in the death of her boyfriend, a Boston police officer, in 2022. Her first trial last year ended in a mistrial.

title: William G. Young, a Reagan-Appointed Judge, Is Fast-Tracking Trump to Trial
summary: Judge William G. Young’s long career has been punctuated by high-profile cases and outspoken advocacy for the judiciary’s value and fact-finding power.

title: Under China’s Threat, Taiwan Needs Its Own Power Sources More Than Ever
summary: Taiwan, which makes most of the world’s advanced computer chips, relies almost entirely on imported energy.

title: Your A.I. Queries Come With a Climate Cost
summary: When it comes to artificial intelligence, more intensive computing uses more energy, producing more greenhouse gases.

title: Real Risk to Youth Mental Health Is ‘Addictive Use,’ Not Screen Time Alone, Study Finds
summary: Researchers found children with highly addictive use of phones, video games or social media were two to three times as likely to have thoughts of suicide or to harm themselves.

title: When Humans Learned to Live Everywhere
summary: About 70,000 years ago in Africa, humans expanded into more extreme environments, a new study finds, setting the stage for our global migration.

title: New Owner for High Times Magazine Bets on a Counterculture Comeback
summary: The anti-establishment magazine, which was taken over by a private equity firm in 2017, was purchased this week by an avid fan and reader for $3.5 million.

title: An Iran Strategy for Trump
summary: First, destroy Fordo. Then make the mullahs an offer they can’t refuse.

title: A Progressive Future Depends on National Identity
summary: Tough border policies aren’t just good politics. They’re progressive, as Britain’s Labour Party shows.

title: Regulators Approve Lenacapavir for H.I.V. Prevention
summary: The drug could change the course of the AIDS epidemic. But the Trump administration has gutted the programs that might have paid for it in low-income countries.

title: Hurricane Erick Nears Mexico’s Coast as Category 3 Storm
summary: “If you are in low-lying areas, near rivers, near waterways, it is best for you to go to shelters,” President Claudia Sheinbaum said.

title: Ex-Yankee Is Awarded About $500,000 in Damages for Moldy Greenwich Mansion
summary: Josh Donaldson, a former American League Most Valuable Player with Toronto, sued his former landlord over the conditions at his $55,000-a-month rental property.

title: Stanley Nelson, Journalist Who Investigated Klan Murders, Dies at 69
summary: Born and raised in Louisiana, he investigated unresolved civil-rights-era killings in the Deep South. His reporting on one of those cases made him a Pulitzer Prize finalist.
